titleStmt.title: J. W. Huff to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2103

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Paintsville Johnson County
Kentucky May 1st 1865
To youre excellency
Govoner of Kentucky

I do hereby tender My Resignation as Justice of the peace for Johnson County ^in District No 1^ and moste Sincerly beg that you receve the same and fill my vacancy and mutch oblige youre obedient servan^t^
J. W. Huff J. P. J. C
I hereby recommend Thos S Williams as a fit person to fill the vacancy occasioned by the resignation of J W Huff a Justice of the Peace this 6th day of June 1865

H. E. Conley P
Judge of the Johnson County Court
Justice Peace
Johnson Co
Resignation & appointment
12 June/65
